verses.roman:
ity abhipretya rājendra
sudāmā prīta-mānasaḥ
śastaiḥ su-gandhaiḥ kusumair
mālā viracitā dadau

synonyms: iti—thus speaking; abhipretya—understanding Their intention; rāja-indra—O best of kings (Parīkṣit); sudāmā—Sudāmā; prīta-mānasaḥ—pleased at heart; śastaiḥ—fresh; su-gandhaiḥ—and fragrant; kusumaiḥ—with flowers; malaḥ—garlands; viracitāḥ—made; dadau—he gave.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] O best of kings, having spoken these words, Sudāmā could understand what Kṛṣṇa and Balarāma wanted. Thus with great pleasure he presented Them with garlands of fresh, fragrant flowers.
